title: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] Unable to open file in another editor if it is already opened in one editor (should display error message)
description: Bug 12906[Editor Mgmt] If file is already opened in one editor, cannot open in another editor (should give error msg)
OB: When a file is already opened in an editor and I try to open the same file in another editor by right-clicking on it and selecting 'Open With -> System Editor', nothing happens. I expect the workbench to display a warning message indicating that opening the file in another editor may result in overwriting changes, and asking if I want to continue. Alternatively, an error message should be displayed stating that all files should be closed first. Currently, there is no warning or error message displayed.
EB: However, there should be a warning or error message indicating that opening the file in another editor may lead to overwriting changes.
SR:
To reproduce the issue: 
1. Close the currently opened file. 
2. Go to the Java Perspective. 
3. Open a Java file by double-clicking on it. 
4. The file is now opened in the workbench. 
5. Right-click on the Java file. 
6. Select 'Open With -> System Editor'. 
7. Observe that nothing happens and no warning or error message is displayed.
